intro: Gyrostachys constricta, commonly known as the narrowleaf sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Geraniaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered leaves. The plant produces showy, violet-blue flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a hardy, drought-tolerant species. Its botanical features make it a valuable addition to xeriscaped gardens and native plant landscapes.
